div.a: Climate Change Is The Real Fiscal Cliff

div.div: The estimated cost of Hurricane Sandy is now more than $60 billion, and that doesn’t take into consideration the amount of money lost in disrupted business. In other words, by not addressing climate change, we’re walking ourselves off the fiscal plank.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/126IdYW&via=Digg&text=Climate Change Is The Real Fiscal Cliff

div.a: Bill Gates Is $7 Billion Richer Than He Was A Year Ago

div.div: After giving away $28 billion, Bill Gates is no longer the third-richest man in the world. He's the second-richest.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TIiRMC&via=Digg&text=Bill Gates Is $7 Billion Richer Than He Was A Year Ago

div.a: This Is What Fireworks Look Like In Reverse

div.div: Filmmaker Julian Tay shot some footage of the 2012 New Years fireworks at Docklands in Melbourne, Australia and then decided to see what happened if he digitally reversed it. The result is astounding.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/THXT08&via=Digg&text=This Is What Fireworks Look Like In Reverse

div.a: Feces Wine Is Real, And This Japanese Girl Group Thinks It's 'Delicious'

div.div: Inside: poop, pretty girls and booze. Shh, just come.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YTKOkE&via=Digg&text=Feces Wine Is Real, And This Japanese Girl Group Thinks It's 'Delicious'

div.a: Father Hires In-Game 'Hitmen' To Deter Son From Playing

div.div: Sick and tired of his son playing video games and not listening to him, a father in China decided to take matters into his own hands... well, sort of.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vijnk0&via=Digg&text=Father Hires In-Game 'Hitmen' To Deter Son From Playing

div.a: Chris Christie Destroys Republicans Over Lack Of Sandy Support

div.div: New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie absolutely unloaded on House Republicans for spiking the hurricane relief bill last night. It's must-see video.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UkQEd4&via=Digg&text=Chris Christie Destroys Republicans Over Lack Of Sandy Support

div.a: A New Year's Spike In Poisonings

div.div: January 1 is unique among major holidays as a suicide flashpoint.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z8hsDK&via=Digg&text=A New Year's Spike In Poisonings

div.a: It Turns Out Dr. Oz Is A Terrible Doctor

div.div: "Dr. Oz's promotion of... unproven or disproven alternative treatments is irresponsible and borders on quackery.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WimZkJ&via=Digg&text=It Turns Out Dr. Oz Is A Terrible Doctor

div.div: Google is gaining ground against Facebook thanks to a controversial tactic: requiring people to use the Google+ social network.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/134KkvW&via=Digg&text=Even Googlers Hate Google+

div.a: Why Do Innocent People Confess To Crimes?

div.div: Japan has a conviction rate of more than 99%. But in recent months there has been a public outcry over a number of wrongful arrests where innocent people confessed to crimes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10KXeR3&via=Digg&text=Why Do Innocent People Confess To Crimes?

div.a: The US Military's 'Bath Salts' Prevention Video Is Completely Terrifying

div.div: If you take bath salts, your girlfriend will transform into a demon, and you will punch her.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZUXJcd&via=Digg&text=The US Military's 'Bath Salts' Prevention Video Is Completely Terrifying

div.a: How 'Guitar Hero' Became A Billion Dollar Business

div.div: aCharles and Kai Huang sold more than 30MM units of Guitar Hero becoming one of the top videogame franchises of all time. Here's their fascinating story.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UxxvXU&via=Digg&text=How 'Guitar Hero' Became A Billion Dollar Business

div.div: DON'T ASK WHAT HAPPENS IF YOU RUN A RED

div.a: It's Now Illegal To Run A Yellow Light In China

div.div: Is yellow the new red? In China, running yellow traffic lights is officially illegal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UEBC4s&via=Digg&text=It's Now Illegal To Run A Yellow Light In China

div.a: The 10 Weirdest Parts Of The Fiscal Cliff Bill

div.div: You've probably already heard all about the fiscal cliff bill that Congress finally passed on Tuesday. But we bet you haven't heard about these corporate tax breaks and other arcane provisions, covering everything from electric scooters to NASCAR racetracks to taking the subway to work.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W1iM4k&via=Digg&text=The 10 Weirdest Parts Of The Fiscal Cliff Bill

div.a: Can You Afford The Future Of TV?

div.div: The platonic ideal of television's future is a la carte consumption: the ability to pay only for the channels you want. But maybe the question isn't can—or will—this happen some day. What we should really be asking is: when it does happen, what will it cost us?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WezfCE&via=Digg&text=Can You Afford The Future Of TV?

div.a: Ray Kurzweil's Top 5 Reasons To Be Optimistic For 2013

div.div: Will you be better off this year than your were in the past? To the futurist and inventor Ray Kurzweil, the answer is a resounding yes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WY1bNw&via=Digg&text=Ray Kurzweil's Top 5 Reasons To Be Optimistic For 2013

div.a: Tech's Hot New Market: The Poor

div.div: The market these startups have chosen stands out because of how starkly it contrasts with the privileged techie class seeking to profit off it: an industry awash in money deliberately targeting people who decidedly aren’t.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VgFg35&via=Digg&text=Tech's Hot New Market: The Poor

div.a: Inside The Prison Journal Of West Memphis Three’s Damien Echols

div.div: In the new documentary ‘West of Memphis,’ Damien Echols tells the story of how he was wrongly convicted of a heinous murder. Here, he shares how 18 years in prison changed his approach to life.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RpucCz&via=Digg&text=Inside The Prison Journal Of West Memphis Three’s Damien Echols

div.a: The Jurassic Park Video Game You've Been Waiting For Since 1993

div.div: Although it doesn't have any official support from the franchise, this mod of a 2004 Jurassic Park game is the most faithful-looking attempt at a recreation of the first film's plot yet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RtnfAk&via=Digg&text=The Jurassic Park Video Game You've Been Waiting For Since 1993

div.div: A FUNGUS WITH THE ULTIMATE ORIGIN STORY

div.a: Five Organisms With Real Super Powers That Rival Their Comic Book Counterparts

div.div: For practically every super power we can imagine, something on the tree of life has come up with a real-world analog. Some real super powers are more super than others.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rtla7z&via=Digg&text=Five Organisms With Real Super Powers That Rival Their Comic Book Counterparts

div.a: Al Jazeera Said To Be Acquiring Current TV

div.div: Al Jazeera is finalizing a deal to take over Current TV, the low-rated cable channel that was founded by Al Gore and his business partners seven years ago.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VvhxMf&via=Digg&text=Al Jazeera Said To Be Acquiring Current TV

div.div: NOT SO FUNNY NOW, IS IT?

div.a: Meet Egypt's Jon Stewart, Who Is Now Under Investigation For Satire

div.div: In another sign that President Mohamed Morsi’s Egypt may not be as democratic as the country’s revolutionaries had hoped, Egyptian lawyers have launched an investigationinto a popular TV host there, arguing that he insulted Morsi on his Daily Show-esque television program.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10OmvtJ&via=Digg&text=Meet Egypt's Jon Stewart, Who Is Now Under Investigation For Satire

div.a: 8:52 P.M. Is Your Best Chance Of Scoring An Online Date In 2013

div.div: Researchers suggest that as people return to work after New Year's and face the ugly truth of their lives, they're more open than at any other time to an online encounter.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UGvl8F&via=Digg&text=8:52 P.M. Is Your Best Chance Of Scoring An Online Date In 2013

div.a: The Great Canadian Maple Syrup Heist

div.div: Some $18 million in syrup was stolen this summer. Were the thieves dirty outlaws or capitalist heroes?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UERfJb&via=Digg&text=The Great Canadian Maple Syrup Heist

div.a: How To Gain Or Lose 30 Minutes Of Life Every Day

div.div: Consequences of good and bad health habits are boiled down to 30-minute slices of your life.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10IxlBk&via=Digg&text=How To Gain Or Lose 30 Minutes Of Life Every Day
